Articles.Content:
Last weekend i catched my first 2 asteroids in a kerbin-orbit

One class E and one class C.

Then i put an ore-to-fuel-chain on it to use them as refueling stations.

But on both rocks they say: No Ore.

I watched some how-tos and lets plays, but i cant find a solution or tips

for my circumstances.

Do i have to do scans before?

Are not all asteroids mineable?

Do i make other mistakes?

Thanks for tips/tricks/hints.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-17T12:14:34Z" title="06/17/2015 12:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 17, 2015</time> by Jansn**

"Asteroids contain a finite amount of ore [...] There is no need to use any scanners to find out the ore concentration for asteroids, its enough to be close to it or own it." - Kerbal Wiki

And that's all I've got for you... Don't know what's wrong. Maybe you already mined all that asteroid had?

Thanks for your reply. I already read that in the Wiki.

I never mined Asteroids in 1.0x. (Did Kethane in 0.90.)

Maybe i still dont "own" them (by "sloppy" orbit)?

Maybe the grabbing unit isnt enough/right part to mine?

Maybe because i have no Ore-container on board, 

i wanted to stream ore directly to the ISRU -> empty tank.

Thanks again. Lets see whats coming up more...
maybe you don't have an excavator, or an ore tank. the ISRU alone can not mine fresh ore or the miner doesn't have an ore tank to act as a buffer.

Yes, no buffer tank. 

Mine -> ISRU -> empty tank dont work?

It definitiv need a buffer tank?

Excavator/drill is onboard and ready to use.

In an asteroid which I was mining, while the single ore tank in that ship had (mistakenly) the ore flow disabled (in the same way you can disable Lf/Ox flow in a fuel can) the excavators would mine but no ore was taken from the asteroid and nothing would reach the ISRU.
I can confirm that you need an ore tank. At least that's what I experienced on my mining operation.
you definitely need an ore tank
Maybe also, don't choose the option 'mining for ore' ore something like that. You have a second option on an Asteroid called 'start Asteroid harvester', you have to choose that one

Thanks everybody. Now i can confirm too that you need an ore tank.

I think there was only a "Start Asteroid Harvester" button.

Thanks again and keep mining.
